pr_title: Add more msal, msal w/ broker, usgov UI Automated Tests

timeline.message: Deactivate CP device admin then delete again
Add more msal and broker UI tests
Add device enrollment failure recovery rule
Add comments to MSAL test cases
Add todo to fix B2C test
Add links to ADO test cases

timeline.bodyText: Very minor nit: could be Assert.fail (assuming this is imported)
timeline.author: iambmelt

timeline.bodyText: missing "Change the device time one hour forward."
timeline.author: rpdome

timeline.bodyText:
It's not matching the test case (the test case asks the tester to launch AzureSample).
Let's make sure they're matching. In this case, I'm fine either making changes here or there.
timeline.author: rpdome

replies.bodyText: I'll update the test case in ADO.....as I remember that I did it this way because I realized we didn't need to go into AzureSampleApp to test this
replies.author: shahzaibj

timeline.bodyText: curious, how does the test case handle MFA prompt?
timeline.author: rpdome

replies.bodyText: AUTO MFA (provided by LAB). Not sure how it works exactly. But the server calls the phone number registered with the account (I don't know what that number is) and some automated setup from the LAB Team responds to that phone call. So there is really nothing required from us....we are just waiting for the MFA prompt to be handled automatically by the LAB setup.
replies.author: shahzaibj

timeline.bodyText: nit: can we rename this function to something like "forwardDeviceTimeForOneHour()"?
timeline.author: rpdome

replies.bodyText: I'll rename to forwardDeviceTimeForOneDay() as that's what it does 😁
replies.author: shahzaibj

timeline.message: Rename method to change device time
